Sub-staging information (such as 'mi' in pN1mi) does not affect T staging.
The Nottingham score, nuclear grade, tubule formation, mitotic activity score, and total Nottingham score do not affect T staging.
The presence of microcalcifications, fibrocystic changes, skin involvement, non-neoplastic breast tissue, and estrogen and progesterone receptor status do not affect T staging.
The method(s) of lymph node examination and sentinel node metastasis do not affect T staging.
HER2/CEP 17 ratio or HER2 gene amplification does not affect T staging.
Tumor aggregate size or the sum of the sizes of multiple invasive tumors does not affect T staging.

T stages are based on the largest tumor size for invasive carcinomas.
T1: Tumor size is 2.0 cm or less.
T1a: Tumor size is up to 0.5 cm.
T1b: Tumor size is more than 0.5 cm but not more than 1 cm.
T1c: Tumor size is more than 1 cm but not more than 2 cm.
T2: Tumor size is more than 2.0 cm but not more than 5.0 cm.
T3: Tumor size is more than 5.0 cm.
T4: Tumor of any size with direct extension to the chest wall and/or skin.
Infiltrating papillary adenocarcinoma, polymorphocellular undifferentiated breast carcinoma, invasive mucinous carcinoma, invasive duct carcinoma, invasive adenocarcinoma of the breast, and invasive lobular carcinoma are all considered invasive carcinomas for T staging purposes.
